alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 7:02PM MST until July 21 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE TELEGRAPH BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR GILA COUNTY... At 702 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain over the Telegraph Burn Scar. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Webcams show considerable flow in Six Shooter Canyon and Ice House Canyon. Beer Tree Crossing in Globe experienced a rapid rise in runoff, over 1.5 feet. Flash flooding is already occurring. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Six Shooter Canyon, Ice House Canyon, Kellner Canyon, and Russell Gulch. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Telegraph Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Telegraph Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Globe, Central Heights-Midland City and Claypool. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
